title: examples/testscript.py hangs on Kmeans clustering
body:
**Describe the bug**
For deeplabcut v2.1.6, I am getting a hang when running `examples/testscript.py`. I have seen `Kmeans clustering ... (this might take a while)` for over an hour now, on an 8-core Intel i7-9800X X-series processor. All 16 threads are slammed at 100% utilization. I'm happy to keep waiting, but the script comments say this script should finish in 3:30 minutes (which I read as 3min 30sec?) on CPU...unless that is 3 hours 30 minutes?

**To Reproduce**
```
# install nix if not already installed
> curl -L https://nixos.org/nix/install | sh
> git clone https://github.com/tbenst/nixpkgs.git
> cd nixpkgs
> git checkout deeplabcut
> nix-build -I nixpkgs=. -A python3Packages.deeplabcut
```

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):**
 - OS: **NixOS 20.03**
 - DeepLabCut Version [e.g. 22] (please check with ``import deeplabcut``, ``deeplabcut.__version__``) **2.1.6**

**Additional context**
I have slightly modified deeplabcut's required python packages to use Nix's distributed versions: https://github.com/tbenst/nixpkgs/blob/ced8ca5dba8f2e00cd45fd5904f0b08593db205a/pkgs/development/python-modules/deeplabcut/default.nix#L103. Additionally, I run testscript headlessly using `xvfb-run`.
